text: Catawba County is a county in the U.S. state of North Carolina. In 2020, 160,610 people lived there. Its county seat is Newton. == History == The county was made in 1842 from Lincoln County. == Government == Catawba County is part of the local Western Piedmont Council of Governments. == Connected Counties == *Alexander County, North Carolina - north *Iredell County, North Carolina - east *Lincoln County, North Carolina - south *Burke County, North Carolina - west *Caldwell County, North Carolina - northwest == Cities and towns == These cities and towns are in Catawba County: *Brookford *Catawba *Claremont *Conover *Hickory *Lake Norman of Catawba *Maiden *Mountain View *Newton *Sherrills Ford *Longview *St. Stephens == References == == Other websites == *Catawba County government official website *Experience Catawba Category:North Carolina counties Category:1842 establishments in North Carolina
title: Catawba County, North Carolina
